oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mt. Zion Baptist Church, 2001 December
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Mt. Zion Baptist Church located at 1112 Jefferson Street in Nashville, Tennessee. According to the survey this church's congregation was founded in 1866, while the building was constructed in 1905. The foundation is made of rough cut stone blocks. The exterior walls are brick that has been painted red. The roof is gabled and hipped. The windows are stained glass in a combination of arched and square shapes. The windows have plexi-glass coverings. The rear windows have protective bars on their outsides. The doors are a combination of wood, metal and glass. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mt. Zion Baptist Church (Nashville, Tenn.)
